title: Electric fields components for two charges

content.question: Isolated spheres <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are located on the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis of an <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinate system, as shown in the figure. The electric field at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is directed upward along the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. Many dimensions are given in the figure. The charge on sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="nanocoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> .
